title: Pixie Lott glitters in gold suit at Greed London premiere
text:
She's landed her first film role, a small part in the Steve Coogan fronted comedy, Greed.

And Pixie Lott took centre stage on the red carpet for the film's premiere at the BFI London Film Festival on Wednesday night, turning heads in a glittering gold suit as she arrived at the Odeon Luxe Leicester Square.

The singer, 28, was joined by the film's funnymen on the red carpet, including Coogan, David Mitchell and director Michael Winterbottom.

Golden girl: Pixie Lott took centre stage on the red carpet for the Greed premiere at the BFI London Film Festival on Wednesday night, turning heads in a glittering gold suit

Pixie dressed to impress for her big moment, donning a metallic minidress and matching suit jacket with black silk lapels.

She coordinated her strappy heels to her outfit and wore her blonde locks pulled back in a high bun.

The film is about a ghastly retail mogul who throws a wild 60th birthday party in Greece.

Hot metal: Pixie dressed to impress for her big moment, donning a metallic minidress and matching suit jacket with black silk lapels

Looking good: She coordinated her strappy heels to her outfit and wore her blonde locks pulled back in a high bun

Comedy: The film is about a ghastly retail mogul who throws a wild 60th birthday party in Greece

It will also star actress Isla Fisher while Made In Chelsea star Ollie Locke will have a cameo, something he is very excited about.

Ollie told MailOnline: 'I actually trained to be an actor. But then [Made In] Chelsea came knocking.

'I did it because it was a good opportunity and I wasn't really getting acting jobs because of my long hair.'

Career change: Singer James Blunt is adding another string to his bow with a role in the comedy

Isla's husband, actor Sacha Baron Cohen, was originally slated to portray the lead role in the film but dropped out of the project and was replaced by Steve Coogan.

Meanwhile, singer James Blunt is adding another string to his bow with a role in the comedy.

A source told The Sun: 'James has released five albums now, so he has been more than happy to take on a new challenge.

'He is known for his self-deprecating sense of humour, especially with his witty remarks on Twitter, so he jumped at the chance to star in a comedy.'

Stepping out: Doctor Who star Pearl Mackie is also taking on a starring role in the comedy

In attendance: David Mitchell and his wife Victoria Coren were celebrating his new role

Proud: Director Michael Winterbottom posed with Coogan as they entered the cinema
